description:
Alma Tandoji lives a lonely life. One day, Ruri Alba, a girl accompanied by her butler and maids, visits him. Knowing the power of Sacred Seven is latent within Alma, she asks him to lend her his powers. However, he refuses and drives her away since he injured many with his unusual strength in the past.

Meanwhile, a fiendish Dark Stone creature suddenly appears in this peaceful town in the Kanto region. Only Alma's power of Sacred Seven can fight against it. But Alma just lets his power run amuck and things begin to get worse. Ruri raised her gemstone in order to release his true abilities, My Soul I give to you.

With Ruri's wishes engraved in it, will Alma be able to defeat the Dark Stone?

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

node.description: [Website](http://www.nanriyuuka.com/)

__Blood Type:__ A
__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")
__Hobby:__ Collecting records, watching professional wrestling
__Agency:__ Stay Luck

[Profile](https://stay-luck.com/talent/nakajima-megumi) | [Website](https://nakajima-megumi.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mamegu_staff) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkOGw3UbTMkj8U0VYzdmi5A) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/24277.html)

Born of a Japanese father and a Filipino mother, Megumi was brought up in a "house filled with music" and grew up with the desire to sing.  In 2003, she participated in the "Self Stardust Promotion" contest and passed, thereby affiliating her to the agency. In 2007, she auditioned to the Victor Entertainment sanctioned "Victor Vocal & Voice Audition" and won the role to voice Ranka Lee in Macross Frontier.  She is also the voice provider for the Vocaloid, [Megpoid](https://anilist.co/staff/140519).

She is affiliated with Stay Luck for voice acting and FlyingDog for singing.

[Profile](https://stay-luck.com/talent/nakajima-megumi) | [Website](https://nakajima-megumi.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mamegu_staff) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkOGw3UbTMkj8U0VYzdmi5A) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/24277.html)

[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Yuki Kajiura was born in Japan but raised in West Germany for most of her childhood. Her father was a big fan of classical and opera music and always desired for Yuki to play the piano for him. Yuki eventually gained a love for music and a love for the piano. Yuki started out as an SE programmer, but changed to music in 1992. She made her grand debut with a female trio called "[See-Saw](https://anilist.co/staff/104342)."  In the years to come the group released six singles and two albums. 

Yuki then went on to work on her solo career composing for artists and some TV, films, and games, such as _Blood: The Last Vampire_ in 2001, and _Xenosaga II_ and _III_. In 2001, Yuki's claim to fame came with the release of the anime [_NOIR_](https://anilist.co/anime/272). The soundtrack sold 50,000 copies. In 2002, she was brought on to project .hack to write the score to [_.hack//SIGN_](https://anilist.co/anime/48), along with vocalist [Chiaki Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101059) and New York singer [Emily Bindiger](https://anilist.co/staff/103845). Shortly after Yuki comprised an album of original and complied songs known as Fiction, working again with Emily Bindiger as well as _Xenosaga_ vocalist Deb Lyons.  

Yuki's other well-known works were for [_Mobile Suite Gundam Seed_](https://anilist.co/anime/93), which hit 5th on the Oricon Charts its first week, and selling over 200,000 copies. Yuki has also become known for her work on CLAMP's [_Tsubasa Chronicle_](https://anilist.co/anime/177) series, [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/807), and [OVAs](https://anilist.co/anime/2685). In 2003, she formed the project [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) in which pairs Yuki's songwriting and composition with different performing vocalists, first as separate solo works and later into a singular group. In 2007, Yuki formed the band [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975), with two partners from FictionJunction, Wakana Ootaki and [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664), to perform for the anime [_Kara no Kyoukai_](https://anilist.co/anime/2593), further working on several others. Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ToshiSahashi)

__Toshihiko Sahashi__ is a Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music in 1986. Sahashi has composed music for various anime series (including OVAs, films, and drama CDs), video games, films, dramas, and musicals.

The style of his composition is richly symphonic and classical (occasionally jazz). The use of sophisticated compositional techniques, as well as complicated harmony writing such as fugue can often be heard in his work, demonstrating his solid training in the western classical music. He also uses keyboard instruments to deliver more sentimental soundtracks to good effect.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=naoyuki_konno)

__Naoyuki Konno__ is a Japanese animator and director. He is particularly known for his work on several adaptations of [Shoutarou Ishinomori's](https://anilist.co/staff/97478/Shoutarou-Ishinomori) works as well as his animation style, being renowned as one of the Kanada-school animators.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/千羽由利子)

One of the nine founders of [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1002418889362272256) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/inomata-mutsumi/)

An animator turned illustrator originally from [Ashi Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/196/).

name.native: フィクションジャンクション

node.description:
FictionJunction is a solo project by the composer [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077), consisting of collaborations with several vocalists, all of which are female (aka utahime). Kajiura herself plays the keyboard or the piano.

From 2003 to 2009, the project was fragmented into duo groups with Kajiura and the soloists with the name "FictionJunction 〇〇" (ex. "FictionJunction KAORI") but in 2009 they all unified under the name "FictionJunction."

__Utahime:__
• KAORI - [Kaori Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/101399) (織田かおり) (also joined [Sound Horizon](https://anilist.co/staff/100754))
• KEIKO - [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664) (窪田啓子) (also member of [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975))
• WAKANA - Wakana Ootaki (大滝若奈) (also member of [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975))
• YURIKO KAIDA - [Yuriko Kaida](https://anilist.co/staff/103489) (貝田由里子) (also works solo as KAiiDA)
• YUUKA - [Yuuka Nanri](https://anilist.co/staff/95366) (南里侑香)
• ASUKA - [Asuka Kato](https://anilist.co/staff/103810) (加藤あすか) (also works solo as Aira Yuuki)

__Guest vocalists:__
• [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859) - (has participated in live performances since 2019)
• [LiSA](https://anilist.co/staff/105561) - (featured on the song "from the edge")
• Revo - (has participated in live performances)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nabe_atsu_live)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoohmish)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/145049847)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/145049847)
_Note: Not to be confused with the [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/119169/)._
_Note: Not to be confused with the [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/119169/)._
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/unicococ)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/283471638)

Originating from [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yama_ic)

Yamashita is one of the key figures of the "Web Generation," being among the first to be recruited within the industry not after formal training but after demonstrating his talent by posting animated gifs online.

His first time standing out of the crowd was on [Birdy the Mighty Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/Birdy-the-Mighty-Decode/). His animation favors expression above all else, to the point characters often bend out of shape when exposed to extreme forces and speeds. 

Despite this he still has a keen eye for delicate and realistic character animation, inspired by the likes of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/Norio-Matsumoto), as demonstrated on both EDs for Birdy the Mighty Decode and [Shinsekai yori](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/From-the-New-World/) where he handled all aspects of the animation production. 

He is also adept in post production work, often handling the photography, coloring and even CG in his own works.

title.native: 戦姫絶唱シンフォギア
